Airport Classification: Reliever/General Aviation Suburban

1. Awareness of Advanced Air Mobility (AAM) Weight 20% Select a level (1, 2 or 3) for each question below.

Does the airport have an understanding of Urban Air Mobility Initiatives (UAM)? (e.g., FAA & NASA UAM Initiatives; OEM and Service Provider partnerships, Electrification of Aviation Initiatives Alternative aviation approaches being developed and tested)

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Market Study

Has there been any coordination with city and department of transportation planners, state aeronautics, MPOs, AOGs, transit agencies, and other stakeholders to identify common goals for UAM, multimodal integration, or smart city initiatives?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Business Case

Are there any flight schools, General Aviation tenants, or Ground Support Equipment operators who are looking at upgrading their fleets to electrical powerplants?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Business Case

Does the airport have an awareness of the future decline in petroleum-based fuel and plans to diversify revenue sources?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Market Study
  • Planning
  • Business Case

Has the airport coordinated with OEMs and service providers to understand opportunities and specific needs to incorporate before planning for UAM initiatives?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Market Study
  • Use Cases

Has the airport identified funding for UAM initiatives?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Business Case

Is there an innovative culture, champion, and/or organization at the airport or city that could support UAM?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Business Case
2. Readiness for AAM Weight 45% Select a level (1, 2 or 3) for each question below.

Is there a demand in the area for UAM from the community or current tenants? (e.g., Passenger Air Mobility, Air Cargo, Emergency Services)

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Market Study

Have airport resources been identified for future growth opportunities? (e.g., electrical system, operational density, land use, zoning requirements, lease agreement modifications)

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Planning

Has the airport master plan been updated to incorporate UAM or electrification initiatives?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Planning

Has the airport planned or coordinated with the city for community engagement for UAM initiatives?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Community Engagement

Are local or state policies or ordinances prohibitive to new UAM operations at the airport?

  • Business Case
  • Planning

Do you have political support for UAM development?

  • Business Case
  • Planning

Have current leases been evaluated and updated plans created in anticipation of collaboration with new UAM tenants at the airport?

  • Planning

Have you considered location of curbside facilities and determined if they are available to support UAM operations?

View PDF Guidebook

  • Planning

Have there been discussions around the availability of a sustainable workforce to support new operations in the area?

View PDF Guidebook

  • Community Engagement

Have there been any discussions with housing authorities to determine if there is available housing in the community to support new workforce entrants?

  • Business Case
  • Planning

Have there been discussions regarding training programs or growth paths to train new workers for Urban Air Mobility initiatives with State Aeronautics directors or Academia in the area?

  • Business Case
  • Planning

Is there multimodal integration to facilitate first-mile/last-mile connections to/from the airport?

  • Multimodal

Is the distance of the airport from economic activity centers prohibitive to facilitating UAM?

  • Multimodal

Has there been discussions with other multimodal entities to discuss common goals for integration of UAM & other multimodal options?

3. Infrastructure for AAM Weight 35% Select a level (1, 2 or 3) for each question below.

Are you aware of the development goals for the adjacent land surrounding your airport?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Planning

Is there available space at the airport to accommodate UAM facilities or operations? (e.g., Passenger Air Mobility, Air Cargo, Emergency Services)

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Planning

Does the airport have areas that could be utilized as a vertiport or multimodal node?

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Planning

Do you have capacity for new tenants who will support UAM? (.e.g., Concessions, Maintenance Facilities, UAM Support Businesses, Package Delivery Hubs, etc.)

View PDF Guidebook

To advance your knowledge on this topic further or for guidance to advance your readiness level visit these chapters in the guidebook.

  • Planning

Has the airport met with utility companies to identify the electrical load of the airport and understand the capacity for future growth of the electrical infrastructure?
